posts.name: Grahame
posts.cooked: Hi, please can you add the facility when a group has been setup if a admin wants to remove a comment/chat from the group they can remove from everyone.

link_counts.title: How to delete a message (for everyone) someone else sent?
Disappearing messages should remove older messages as well

posts.name: ‚ö†Ô∏è abandoned account ‚ö†Ô∏è
posts.cooked:
Hi @Carro81 and welcome to Signal Community!

What would this ‚Äúcensorship‚Äù mechanism be good for?
imo, this make the admins vulnerable to (private) ‚Äúgag order(s)‚Äù.
Please elaborate your FR with some examples.

Many Signal users are already unhappy that there is even this possibility for the own messages (up to 3h). For example, I use self-compiled version where ‚Äúremote deletes‚Äù are simply ignored.

posts.name: Eric Gerdum
posts.cooked: In a bigger group there can be some members inside who spam to much or dont respect group rules. So its good for a admin to delete some messages.
That‚Äôs a social problem and doesn‚Äôt/shouldn‚Äôt need a technical solution. Also the admin can delete that person from the group anyway.

What if, instead of having the ability to delete messages, admins could just collapse/hide them so that group members would still have access to the messages but would have to tap the messages to view them?

This would have the same effect of providing admins the ability to reduce clutter in group chats without being accused of ‚Äúcensorship‚Äù or having the false impression of being able to delete messages from other people‚Äôs devices.

posts.name: anon53652
posts.cooked:
Cerberus:

What if, instead of having the ability to delete messages, admins could just collapse/hide them so that group members would still have access to the messages but would have to tap the messages to view them?

In the only use case I encountered where admin delete would be an option this would not help, the user in uestion keeps sending large movies to the group that are not offensive but the sheer data volume is the problem.
Well, then you should turn off automatic download.

posts.name: anon53652
posts.cooked: Unfortunately that can only Signal-wide, not just for one (group) chat.

Then you should seriously talk about the reason for him to share those media and possibly kick him out of a group.

Nevertheless, it should be implemented to make custom settings for each contact/group to overwrite Signal-wide automatic download. In fact, why not opening a new thread about this if this doesn‚Äôt exist already?

anon53652:

the user in uestion keeps sending large movies to the group that are not offensive but the sheer data volume is the problem.

I‚Äôm not sure allowing admins to delete would be much help in that case anyway; the message would still be downloaded, or at least started downloading, before any admin deletion was processed, so if the issue is the data being used, they need to disable auto-download. If the issue is storage on the user‚Äôs device, they can manage their own storage by deleting the messages.

Until groups have the option for admins to mute specific users they‚Äôll just have to ask them to stop sending such large attachments and kick them if necessary.

posts.name: anon53652
posts.cooked:
Herohtar:

I‚Äôm not sure allowing admins to delete would be much help in that case anyway; the message would still be downloaded, or at least started downloading, before any admin deletion was processed,

You‚Äôre right, I didn‚Äôt think this through.

For me and my family this is actually a big sticking point now that we are trying to transition from Whatsapp to Signal.

Our use case is that we want to share pictures and videos of our Son on the group without all the family members spamming the group with replies. This has already happened and we are having to ask them to ‚Äúdelete for everyone‚Äù which is causing problems. Some of my family members are in their 80s and have gotten used to the feature in Whatsapp.

Is this feature against the principles Signal upholds or will it be implemented eventually?

In your particular case, since you don‚Äôt want replies to hit everyone, it might be better for you to start by clicking the camera icon (above the blue pencil icon), adding the media and then selecting the people you want to send the stuff to. It seems there is a limit of 16 people that you can add here. The result is that the stuff you send appears in the one-on-one chats and any replies will only be between you two.

I understand but both myself and my wife want to share pictures amongst family members. This means that photos are shared across multiple conversations when a group is supposed to make this easier and most importantly in one place.
Hmm. There is also another FR which asks for admin ability to mute everyone/select people. That seems more likely to be developed than this FR, IMO.

newuser:

That seems more likely to be developed than this FR, IMO.

Agreed.

It sounds like what @Infinitable really wants is broadcast channels or one of those similar features. Giving the admins the ability to delete messages allows them to ‚Äúclean up‚Äù a group chat to some extent, though it seems likely that if that were ever added, it would still leave the ‚ÄúThis message was deleted‚Äù tombstones, so the amount of cleanup would not be as much as desired. Plus, deleting messages after the fact doesn‚Äôt prevent group members from being spammed with notifications.

Thanks @newuser and @Herohtar. I agree. I‚Äôm after admin only posting and not necessarily admins selectively deleting messages.

I will keep an eye on the other FR.
I see the use-case, I also see the potential for misuse, maybe devs can limit this to ‚Äúannouncement groups‚Äù where only the admins can send messages?

posts.name: üëäüá∫üá∏üî•
posts.cooked: And maybe have the same three hour limit to prevent abuse. But this opens a larger discussion around censorship and moderation.

posts.name: Ponytail
posts.cooked:
Hide? Okay.
Delete? Not okay. (My opinion)

Also, check this out,

Feature to Stop Fake News in Group Feature Requests
Hello All, One of the biggest challenges we face every day is fake news that spread through groups. I feel funny when my dad comes and tells me about fake news regarding Covid and I laugh and he gets irritated. Because people believe most things that come from their circle. It is tough to keep a full stop to it, but we can try to come up with a feature as below. If fake news is sent in a group, We have to have multiple ways to mark it as FAKE, lets say option 1 is, Admin can mark it as fake ne‚Ä¶
